target_text: "It is difficult to define and measure. That’s for sure. I think before agile, there was a great focus on product level quality. Mainly free of defects and meets customer’s needs. I saw in agile a shift toward code quality and a design that responds to change. There is also a continuous improvement of the process effort."

Codebook.Definition: The challenge associated with defining and quantifying certain concepts or processes.
The focus on ensuring that a product is free of defects and meets the needs of the customer.
The emphasis on maintaining high standards in the writing of code, ensuring it is efficient, clean, and adaptable to change.
The ability of a design to adapt and respond effectively to changes.
The ongoing effort to enhance processes, making them more efficient and effective over time.
